body.name: Razor (Dark Slayers MC Book 5)
body.description: My protector was a seductive, drop dead gorgeous biker. I found out all too late that he might be a stone cold killer as well.Hooking up with a hot, muscle-bound biker in my massage studio? A mistake.Getting blackmailed over it? A disaster.Believing the man I loved slaughtered my blackmailer? Life-shattering.Razor ripped through my life like a hurricane. He lured me in with seductive words and a big tattooed body made for pure sin. We fell hard and fast for each other.But the day I meant to tell him I was pregnant with his twins, the police came knocking on my door, looking for my blackmailer’s killer. My entire world shattered in an instant.Was Razor the killer? Maybe. Probably.Pregnant with his twins, I couldn’t take a chance.So I did the only thing I could. -- I ran.For five years I hid, but my past finally found me.I was stalked. Then, someone burnt my mom’s house to the ground.Was it Razor seeking revenge against me for taking his children?I must confront him and my fears to discover the truth.So I come back…When we meet again, it’s like no time has passed.Razor is still that hot inked biker with huge muscles, deep, penetrating eyes, and a wicked sense of humor I remembered.And his genuinely warm smile makes me question everything I ever thought was true.As we grow close again and my feelings for him burn hotter every day, guilt consumes me. I have to tell him about the twins – and why I left. When I do, will he ever be able to forgive me?And more importantly, if he’s not the killer, then who is?Razor’s story is the fifth book in the "Dark Slayers MC” hot and alluring romance series featuring bikers who will remind you why you like the bad boys so much. They’re protective, rough, and running on pure diesel and adrenaline.Each book in the series is a standalone with a guaranteed happily ever after for the couple, though it is recommended to read them in order for maximum enjoyment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this series. Razor and Laura have a lot of baggage to unpack, but this also makes their story great! I can't wait to see them grow as a couple in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This series gets more exciting with every book I read! Soooo good! loved Razor and Laura’s story so much drama and poor Laura such bad things happening to her. Their love story is so hot and sexy read it you won’t regret it! The alpha’s in each of these stories are so hot that you’ll want one of your own!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Razor has a appointment with a message therapist because his work in construction is giving him problems with stress and problems sleeping. So Laura is the therapist and once he see her he feels as attractions but is trying to be very professional. Laura also can’t believe the attraction to this big biker guy and is trying hard to be professional. Well it works until their first date then they both can resist this attraction. But trouble is spying on them and soon everything pulls them apart. But almost five years later that trouble is still playing with her and puts them in each other’s life’s again. Only to cause more trouble. So enjoy another good read and see the secrets and how much trouble comes their way before they get a HEA!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another Amazing Book!!!
reviews.reviewText: Razor and Laura had so much drama and turmoil in their life I didn’t think they would ever overcome it. I was on the edge of my seat the whole book. Hey finally did get their HEA. The character development and the world building in this series is phenomenal. I’m so glad I found this author! I highly recommend it this series!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Lauren was a little slow getting her act together but love conquers all..eventually. Now, when is Thunder and Rosie going to get a story ? I think it should sizzle and crack. Thunder is a true alpha.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars story was lame
reviews.reviewText: This story started out good and the epilogue was good but the body of the story was lame. There were so many stupid decisions made by Laura and her mother was awful. The reasoning behind her choices were ridiculous.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars When the Past Comes Back!!
reviews.reviewText: You give everything to someone knowing they are the one and they walk away with out looking back. Then she comes back with a stalker and two little ones that He sees every day in the mirror. Definitely recommend this book and series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This was well written with characters from previous oaks in the series. Biker meets someone for back therapy. It turns into a budding relationship. An incident happens, trust is lost and drama, trauma, kidnapping and meddling relatives cause trouble for the couple. The guiding stars are the twins. They are very funny. I did not like her reaction and distrust when she is the one that did the distrustful acts. Almost stopped reading it at that point. Stupid does make a good story. Fortunately I stayed until the HEA was reached. She did not deserve this biker. No cheating, no cliffhanger.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 29, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This book had its up and down intriguing and drama. I loved the biker thing and brotherhood. Let get busy with no 6

Laura may not have seemed so idiotic if there would have been a little more reasoning in her past to support her so called trust issues with men. If anything her trust issues stemmed from her mother moving on so quickly. I found myself shaking my head a lot at her ridiculous decision making rationalisations. All of this was surprising because the female characters in previous books were better written.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 11, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This is the fifth book in this phenomenal series and is Razor and Laura's story. This is a well written flawless story which has engaging and realistic characters with emotions, suspense, humour, intrigue, danger, lies, and love, which all leads to a riveting and addictive page turner. I look forward to reading more from this talented author whose work I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was a good read enjoyed read of Laura and razor story from the start. Looking for ward to more in the series

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I liked that this book had a slow burn introduction to Razor and Laura and showed them together as a couple before she ran away, often these tropes start with them meeting back up and don’t cover back story - in this book I thought they was invaluable and endeared the characters to me a little more, which was a good thing as though I enjoyed the book overall, Laura did grate on me somewhat with her doubts and aspersions over Razor, and her inability to process her own feelings and thoughts without letting others impact it.I thought Razor was overall patient and kind, with a slight dark edge (not too much, very much less than any other character in the series so far, in fact he was probably by far the “softest” of the MC)A not wholly unpredictable yet still enjoyable book with lots of romance, brotherhood and danger but not dark at all in relative terms to the MC genre in general.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.
